tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=24, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
VMWare, XenServer, Amazon EC2 Public Cloud, Apache Cloud, Stack Private Cloud, Windows Servers, Linux Servers, Server Operating Systems, Automation

If you are a Systems Administrator looking for a solid position where you will work from a home, please read on! This position supports our internal systems and our SaaS Service. We offer a number of different opportunities to improve your skills and experience! We also deploy models and technologies that many engineers are very excited to be working with!!

We are using VMWare, XenServer, Amazon EC2 Public Cloud, Apache Cloud, Stack Private Cloud, Windows and Linux Servers. As your skills evolve and develop over time there will be advancing technologies to learn and become productive on.

This role will be done remotely, but we do need you to be local to Southern California.

In this role, you will manage, patch and upgrade systems infrastructure, and work within a Security and Compliance controlled environment. We are looking for a Systems Administrator who is comfortable in working with Data Center Hardware and Software Systems.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

1. Opportunity to work for an international company, looking to expand their US presence
2. Job growth, customer facing, highly technical and innovative position
3. INCREDIBLE benefits and perks

What You Will Be Doing

- Installing and configuring new Server Operating Systems and Applications, according to best practice and company guidelines
- Monitoring and repairing Server Operating Systems and Applications
- Performing Patch upgrades on Server Operating Systems and Applications
- Maintaining Service Availability Targets
- Maintaining Service Confidentiality and Integrity
- Working with Engineers diagnosing and resolving issues in our production environment
- Learning technologies to improve yourself and the capabilities of the Team
- Looking for ways to improve the service availability and recovery times
- Working on an On-Call Rota for out of Hours Cover
- Working on designated tasks outside normal working hours as required by the role
- Visiting Data Centers for installation, configuration and maintenance of computer hardware

What You Need for this Position

- BS/MS in technical field with 3-6 years of work experience
- Perform Linux and Windows installations and configurations on these environments without help
- You must be comfortable using a Virtualized Environment such as XenServer or VMWare
- Have basic network knowledge of TCPIP, DNS, DHCP and VLANS, what they mean and their practical uses
- You must have a good working knowledge of configuring and using Monitoring Systems We use Zabbix and CloudWatch
- Understand the basic principles of ITIL, including Change Management, Problem Management and Incident Management
- Tackle technical problem that we are facing in our Application and Infrastructure stack and restore service accordingly
- Must have experience installing and maintaining server hardware, including racking, disk swapping and component replacement
- Experience operating in a compliance and security monitored environment, we operate PCI DSS, SOC2, HIPAA and ISO 27001

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Bonus
- 401k
- Many more perks!So, if you are a Systems Administrator with all of the experience we are seeking, please apply today!!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

items.content:
DevOps Engineer: Automate and scale infrastructure. Remote North America

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: Cybersecurity, SaaS
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: SecurityScorecard | New York, NY

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 4 hours
Office Location: New York, NY. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes

Technologies

amazon-web-services
ansible
devops
scripting
kubernetes

Job description

The Opportunity

SecurityScorecard is hiring an Ops Engineer to bridge the gap between our global development and operational teams who is motivated to help continue automating and scaling our infrastructure. The Ops Engineer will be responsible for setting up and managing the operation of project development and test environments as well as the software configuration management processes for the entire application development lifecycle. Your role would be to ensure the optimal availability, latency, scalability, and performance of our product platforms. You would also be responsible for automating production operations, promptly notifying backend engineers of platform issues, and checking long term quality metrics.

Our infrastructure is based on AWS with a mix of managed services like RDS, ElastiCache, and SQS, as well as hundreds of EC2 instances managed with Ansible and Terraform. We are actively using three AWS regions, and have equipment in several data centers across the world.

This role will be remote in North America, or in our HQ in NY, NY.

Responsibilities

  • Training, mentoring, and lending expertise to coworkers with regards to operational and security best practises. 
  • Reviewing and providing feedback on GitHub Pull Requests to team members AND development teams- a significant percentage of our Software Engineers have written Terraform.
  • Identifying opportunities for technical and process improvement and owning the implementation. 
  • Championing the concepts of immutable containers, Infrastructure as Code, stateless applications, and software observability throughout the organization.
  • Systems performance tuning with a focus on high availability and scalability.
  • Building tools to ease the usability and automation of processes
  • Keeping products up and operating at full capacity
  • Assisting with migration processes as well as backup and replication mechanisms
  • Working on a large-scale distributed environment where you were focused on scalability/reliability/performance
  • Ensuring proper monitoring / alerting are configured
  • Investigating incidents and performance lapses

Come help us with projects such as…

  • Extending our compute clusters to support low latency, on-demand job execution
  • Turning pets into cattle
  • Cross region replication of systems and corresponding data to support low latency access
  • Rolling out application performance monitoring to existing services, extending integrations where required
  • Migration from self hosted ELK to a SaaS stack
  • Continuous improvement of CI/CD processes making builds & deployments faster, safer, and more consistent
  • Extending a Global VPN WAN to a datacenter with IPSec+BGP

Requirements

  • 3+ years of DevOps and/or Operations experience
  • 1+ years of production environment experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • 1+ years using SQL databases (MySQL, Oracle, Postgres)
  • Scripting ability (Bash, Python, C++ a plus)
  • Strong Experience with CI/CD processes (Jenkins, Ansible) and automated configuration tools (Puppet/Chef/Ansible)
  • Experience with container orchestration (AWS ECS, Kubernetes, Marathon/Mesos)
  • Ability to work as part of a highly collaborative team
  • Understanding of monitoring tools like DataDog
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice to Have

  • You knew exactly what is meant by "Turning pets into cattle"
  • Experience working with Kubernetes on bare-metal and/or the AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service.
  • Experience with RabbitMQ, MongoDB, or Apache Kafka.
  • Experience with Presto or Apache Spark.
  • Familiarity with computation orchestration tools such as HTCondor, Apache Airflow, or Argo.
  • Understanding of network concepts- OSI layers, firewalls, DNS, split horizon DNS, VPN, routing, BGP, etc.
  • A deep understanding of AWS IAM, and how it interacts with S3 buckets.
  • Experience with SAFe.
  • Strong programming skills in 2+ languages.
Apply now

About SecurityScorecard

About SSC

At SecurityScorecard, we are revolutionizing the cyber security industry. Our platform has created a new category of enterprise software, which companies worldwide rely on to manage the cyber security posture of their vendors. We are on a mission to create a new language for companies and their partners to communicate, understand, and improve each other’s security posture.

Backed by Sequoia and Google Ventures, we are growing tremendously year over year. As we scale, so does our need for talent - if you are intellectually curious and excited by the idea of contributing to a high-growth startup, we’d love to talk to you.

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Health Benefits Starting Day One
  • 401k
  • Education Stipend
  • Learning and Development
  • Stocked Kitchen
  • Remote Work Options

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=2, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Devops, AWS, SRE, SysAdmin, Docker, RDS, ElastiCache, Linux, Bash, Agile

If you are a Lead DevOps Engineer with 5+ years experience in a SysAdmin, DevOps, SRE or equivalent role? If so, please read on!

We have the least attrition of any company in the greater Los Angeles area and we offer an unparalleled culture on top of competitive pay, benefits and cutting edge technology. This role has the opportunity to be FULLY REMOTE.

This role will report to the Director of Platform Engineering, and will lead a growing team of high-performing engineers.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

Based in Glendale, we are digital data collection company that is setting a higher standard for data quality. Our company is rapidly-growing and we just moved into a beautiful new office. We provide the highest quality and most accurate consumer data to industry leaders in marketing, analytics, and brand.

We have the world's largest insight panels and our members actively participate in millions of surveys with advanced cross-reference & multi-faceted behavioral data points. The information we provide allows clients to understand behavioral trends, create immersive experiences, and be the best.

What You Will Be Doing

-Report to the Director of Platform Engineering, lead a growing team of high-performing engineers
-Help define and enforce DevOps standards, procedures, and guidelines to improve the overall development process
-Provide technical leadership and guidance to both your team members and your peers
-Cultivate a modern DevOps culture throughout teams and establish performance metrics and processes
-Deploy and support high-performance, highly-available infrastructure on AWS
-Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning
-Conduct periodic on-call duties
-Own the day-to-day health, uptime, monitoring, and reliability of our cloud infrastructure
-Work closely with engineering and project management to develop tools and solutions
-Identify tactical issues and react to emerging areas of concern
-Identify unnecessary complexity and remove it

What You Need for this Position

Must-Have Skills:
- 5+ years experience in an SRE/SysAdmin, DevOps, or equivalent role
- 3+ years of production AWS experience, including but not limited to EC2, RDS, ElastiCache, S3, Auto Scale, ELB
- 2+ years of experience in technical leadership role managing DevOps in Agile environments (Scrum)
- Capability to program in at least one language (other than Bash), ideally Python, PHP or Java
- Solid knowledge of the Linux architecture

Nice to Have Skills:
- Experience with container stacks and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, ECS, etc)
- Experience with Configuration Management tools such as Puppet, Chef, Salt, or Ansible
- Experience with Infrastructure as a Code framework such as Terraform
- Experience with Microservices
- Experience with application monitoring tools (DataDog, New Relic, SumoLogic, etc)
- Strong knowledge of core protocols and tech such as TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, load balancers, distributed file systems, key-value and relational databases
- Experience with CI/CD tools and production code deployments

What's In It for You

- Competitive Salary
- Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
- Flexible hours
- Overall engaging and fun atmosphereSo, if you are a Lead DevOps Engineer, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

items.title: 100 % Remote Opportunity BMC Remedy System Engineer
items.content:
Job Title: Sr. BMC Remedy Systems Engineer (Remote Opportunity)
Location: Jacksonville, FL
Duration: 6+ Months
Interview Type: telephonic + skype

*****NO C2C.

Only W2 Candidates without sponsorship. (US Citizens, Green Card Holders)

Job Description:
Senior IT System Engineer- BMC Remedy Developer/Admin is responsible for monitoring, configuration, administration, troubleshooting and maintenance of the BMC Remedy Core Suite and other supporting BMC technologies. Provide technical support and troubleshoot problems and perform scripting/programming to ensure stable and efficient operation of technology solutions. Drive and implement automation enhancements and process improvement efforts, are assigned to multiple complex systems/applications. Lead initiatives, oversee work results, provide training and serve as a technical resource for other Systems Engineers.
Essential Functions:
Configures, and customizes software solutions using the BMC Remedy Action Request System (ARS) platform
Configures, and customizes software solutions using the BMC Remedy IT Service Management ITSM Suite (IM, PM, AM, CM, SLA, CMDB, SRM & ADDM)
Designs and provides software solutions in ARS ensuring the process flow of the Remedy ITSM modules renders expectations in SmartIT/MYIT (Digital Workplace) UI
Experience with supporting the UI for the following BMC Products: Digital Workplace Advanced (DWPA), Smart IT, MY IT
Leverages the software development lifecycle to design, build, test, and implement solutions based on customers requirements
Assists in defining user requirements within the Remedy ITSM client applications
Develop custom applications and workflows to support the automation of manual and resource intensive business processes
Documents coding changes to be used for test and migration plans
Troubleshoots software bugs using client and server logging
Packages coding changes for releases to be migrated between the applicable environments, e.g., development, test and production
Provides the Operations and Maintenance Team system support, as needed
Performs standard administration system configuration
Works as part of a Team on customer engagements
May participate in Disaster Recovery planning and exercise
Preferred Work Experience:
7+ years related work experience or equivalent combination of transferable experience and education.
Preferred Education:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of experience and education
Additional Required Qualifications:
Demonstrated proficiency and experience in design, implementation, monitoring and troubleshooting technical infrastructure or development or
equivalent combination of transferable experience and education
Extensive working knowledge of multiple technologies and their interfaces and integration
Creating and modifying objects using Developer Studio
Competent working in one or more environments highly integrated with an operating system
Experience with Data Migration Tool
Experience with Spoon
Experience implementing and administering/managing technical solutions in major, large-scale system implementations
High critical thinking skills to evaluate alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with business objectives and strategy
Ability to manage tasks independently and take ownership of responsibilities
Ability to learn from mistakes and apply constructive feedback to improve performance
Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment
Proven leadership abilities including effective knowledge sharing, conflict resolution, facilitation of open discussions, fairness and displaying appropriate
levels of assertiveness
Ability to communicate highly complex technical information clearly and articulately for all levels and audiences

Additional Preferred Qualifications:
ITIL Foundations V3
BMC Certified AR System Developer 9.x or higher
Working knowledge of Configuration Management Database (CMDB), Smart Reporting and Analytics
Experience using Agile methodology
Comments for Suppliers: 100% Remote Acceptable

- provided by Dice

tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Devops, CI/CD, AWS, Ansible, Terraform, EC2, RDS, Puppet, Chef, Kubernetes

We are an established Cyber Security startup and are moving in a stage of stable and consistent growth. We have a wonderful work culture and environment, and modern mentality when it comes to hiring the best talent regardless of where you are located in the country. You can work from our offices, or you can work from home completely remotely!

If you are a DevOps Engineer with an Engineering background and are interested in a remote working opportunity, please read on!

*You'll find a series of questions in the application that we'll need you to complete, so please answer those thoroughly in your application.*

What You Will Be Doing

You'll be championing DevOps best practices among your coworkers, focusing on immutable containers, Infrastructure as Code, stateless applications, and software observability

You'll be setting up and managing project development and test environments, as well as software configuration management processes for the entire software development life cycle.

You'll be responsible for ensuring high availability, optimal latency and scalability, and overall performance of our product platforms

You'll automate production operations and monitoring platform issues.

You'll be working with AWS and a blend of managed services including RDS, ElastiCache, SQS, and managing hundreds of EC2 instances with Ansible and Terraform.

What You Need for this Position

At Least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of:

- Devops
- CI/CD
- AWS
- Ansible
- Terraform
- EC2
- RDS
- Puppet
- Chef
- Kubernetes and container orchestration

We'd like to find a great candidate with an Engineering background. Ideally you've got a coding background before moving into DevOps and have experience writing code in at least 2 languages.So, if you are a DevOps Engineer with coding experience and would like to join a great remote team, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

items.content:
Senior DevOps Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: Digital Marketing, Web Development, Web Technology
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: BlueModus | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-07:00) Mountain Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

azure
asp.net-web-api
cloud

Job description

What You Will Be Doing:

  • Work alongside the web development team to support transition and operation of its client web sites/applications in Microsoft Azure Cloud or client on-premise scenarios
  • Deploying, managing, and operating scalable, highly available, and fault-tolerant systems on Azure or client-owned systems
  • Selecting the appropriate Azure service based on compute, data, or security requirements
  • Identifying appropriate use of Azure operational best practices
  • Estimating Azure usage costs and identifying operational cost control mechanisms
  • Responsible for system updates, monitoring, troubleshooting, and providing end-user support
  • Provide production support and management for client cloud servers and environments
  • Develop scripts and tooling to automate build, software release, application deployment, and system and application management
  • Identify and roll out new infrastructure technologies and methodologies.
  • Liaise with 3rd party software and hardware vendors to manage and resolve incidents and technical issues
  • Documenting and keeping up-to-date standard operating procedures related to the duties of the position.

What You Need:

  • A genuine passion for technology
  • Ability to multitask and excellent time management skills
  • A desire to learn and grow technical knowledge
  • 3+ years’ experience in a Cloud Administration, System Admin, Network Engineer and/or similar role
  • Experience working closely with the internal team and clients to understand the process of designing and implementing enterprise-class solutions based on the principles of redundancy, data integrity, security, and recoverability
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Technologies including
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure
  • Experience with DNS
  • Understanding of SQL / MySQL / NoSQL

What We’d Like To Find:

  • Experience working in an agency environment
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer or electronics engineering, information technology or related
Apply now

About BlueModus

In 2001, we started a company trying to bridge the gap between marketers needs and the latest technology. 16 years later we've become a consultative-first technology firm, bringing innovation and transparency to everything we do. We are proud to recently to have been named a Finalist for 2018 Best Places to Work by Denver Business Journal.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Ample paid time off for holidays, vacation and flex days
  • Full health full benefits with medical, dental, vision and disability
  • Casual work environment
  • 401(k) plan + employer match
  • Fully stocked kitchen, snack dispensers, catered lunches 4X a week
  • Flexible work schedule, work from home & remote options
  • Dog friendly office
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Professional development opportunities with conferences & training

items.title: Senior Type System Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=5, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Luna

Senior Type System Engineer

Senior Type-System Engineer Luna is looking for a senior type-system engineer to help build the next generation interpreter and runtime for Luna, a project said by Singularity University to have the potential to change the lives of one-billion people. If you have strong technical skills and a passion for all things compiler, then this role could be the one for you. As a type-system engineer you'll work as part of the compiler team to design and implement Luna's new type system, including its underlying theory, type-checker, and inference engine. This wok is _intrinsic_ to Luna's evolution, and will provide you with the opportunity to collaborate with a world-class team of engineers, community managers, and business developers (with experience at Bloomberg, GitHub, PayPal, to name a few), making your mark on Luna's future. What You'll Do As a senior type-system engineer, you'll be working on the design and development of Luna's new type-system, in conjunction with the rest of the compiler team, to help support the language's evolution. This will involve: * Determining and formalising the theoretical underpinnings of the new type system in a way as to ensure its soundness. * Both theoretical and practical treatments of the theory behind Luna's type system. * Working with the broader compiler team to implement the type-checking and type-inference engines as part of the greater interpreter. * Using the type-system's information to improve the interpreter's functionality and performance, as well as how it interacts with the users. The Skills We're Looking For We have a few particular skills that we're looking for in this role: * Practical and rich experience writing code in a functional programming language such as Haskell or Scala, including experience with type-level programming techniques (3+ years). * Experience working with the theory behind powerful type systems, including row types, type-checking and type-inference algorithms, and dependently-typed systems. * Practical experience building real-world type-systems, including facilities for both type-checking and inference. * An awareness of the UX impacts of type-systems, and a willingness to minimise their often-intrusive nature. * Practical experience in building large and complex software systems. It would be a big bonus if you had: * Experience writing Java and Scala code, as these will be used to implement the type-system. * Experience in writing comprehensive regression tests for both type-inference and type-checking systems. Avoid the confidence gap. You don't have to match all of the skills above to apply! Who You'll Work With You'll be joining a distributed, multi-disciplinary team that includes people with skills spanning from compiler development to data-science. Though you'll have your area to work on, our internal culture is one of collaboration and communication, and input is always welcomed. We firmly believe that only by working together, rather than putting our team members in their own boxes, can we create the best version of Luna that can be. The Details As part of the Luna team you'd be able to work from anywhere, whether that be at home, or on the go! We have team members distributed across the world, from San Francisco, to London, to Kraków. We welcome remote work and flexible schedules, or you can work from the Kraków office (or our planned SF office) if you'd like. We can provide competitive compensation and holiday, as well as the possibility of equity as time goes on. How To Apply? Send us an email at [email protected], and tell us a little bit about yourself and why you think you'd be a good fit for the role! You can also tell us about: * Some of your past work or projects. * Why you'd like to work on Luna, and where you imagine Luna being in 5 years. * The most important features of a team that you'd like to work in. * Whether you take pride in your ability to communicate clearly and efficiently with your team.

items.title: Site Manager
items.content:
Site Manager at SBNation

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

Location: remote

Vox Media contributors thrive on innovation and change while ambitiously seeking to master their subject areas, hone their craft, and improve their communities. We help smart, talented, creative professionals make a meaningful impact in media, technology and the world around them. The Vox Media house of brands includes industry-leading media forces like SB Nation, Eater, The Verge, Vox, Curbed, Recode, Racked and Polygon, and reaches an audience of hundreds of millions, generating over a billion content views each month.

Vox Media’s SB Nation is the fastest-growing online sports media brand and the largest network of more than 300 individual fan-centric sports communities, including SBNation.com, our national flagship property. Our network is powered by the most respected web-native sports journalists. One part of our network needs new leadership, and that’s where you come in.

Welcome to Loud City, the SB Nation blog covering the OKC Thunder, is looking for a new manager.

The manager would be responsible for the following duties:

  • Making sure that the site is publishing every day, and at a volume high enough for the site to continue to grow.
  • Manage the site’s Facebook and Twitter accounts, and help them continue to grow.
  • Recruit, train and manage a staff of contributors that cover Thunder storylines and news on the site.
  • Regular communication with SB Nation management over site goals, traffic, and progress.
  • Moderating and maintaining a vibrant, welcoming site community.

Our best manager candidates will:

  • Have a passion for the Thunder and news and is already familiar with Welcome to Loud City.
  • Understand how to use popular social media networks, like Twitter and Facebook, and be willing to adapt to new best practices.
  • Be able to produce and edit clean copy.
  • Have the organizational skills to manage a staff of multiple people.
  • Be comfortable working in a remote environment.

This is a remote, part-time contractor position that pays a monthly stipend. Some daytime availability is preferred. To apply, please submit a resume detailing any writing and/or management experience, a cover letter that explains why you’re the best fit for the role, and a basketball-related writing sample. You must submit all three items to be considered for this opportunity.

Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply. If your qualifications and experience do not perfectly align with every single thing we’re looking for, but you believe you have the potential to thrive in this role, please apply. Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

Apply for job

items.title: Sr. Cloud Engineer- REMOTE
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Terraform, Packer, Consul, Vault, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Containers

If you are a Sr. Cloud Engineer with experience in Terraform, Packer, Consul and Vault, please read on!

Located in Irvine, California, we specialize in providing engineering consultant services centered around Cloud, DevOps, and Open Source tools. We have been in business for over 5 years and are growing a ton! We are a collaborative bunch so someone who enjoy this type of teamwork will fit in very well here. Although located in Irvine, we are okay with this person being 100% remote!

This Sr. Cloud engineer will have a strong background in AWS as well as HashiCorp/HashiCorp tools. Your experience with Terraform, Packer, Vault and Consul is a MUST! You will enjoy working with clients as well as gathering requirements and being able to transfer these requirements into new and innovative solutions. This role requires 30% travel but is 100% remote!

What You Will Be Doing

-Working heavily with AWS/Azure/GCP
-Collaborating in a team environment
-Consistent client communication

What You Need for this Position

At Least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of:

- Terraform
- Packer
- Consul
- Vault
- AWS
- Google Cloud
- Azure
- Containers

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical

- Vision

- Bonus
- 401kSo, if you are a Sr. Cloud Engineer- REMOTE with experience, please apply today!

items.title: REMOTE Lead DevOps Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=2, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=10, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Devops, AWS, SRE, SysAdmin, Docker, RDS, ElastiCache, Linux, Bash, Agile

If you are a Lead DevOps Engineer with 5+ years experience in a SysAdmin, DevOps, SRE or equivalent role? If so, please read on!

We have the least attrition of any company in the greater Los Angeles area and we offer an unparalleled culture on top of competitive pay, benefits and cutting edge technology. This role has the opportunity to be FULLY REMOTE.

This role will report to the Director of Platform Engineering, and will lead a growing team of high-performing engineers.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

Based in Glendale, we are digital data collection company that is setting a higher standard for data quality. Our company is rapidly-growing and we just moved into a beautiful new office. We provide the highest quality and most accurate consumer data to industry leaders in marketing, analytics, and brand. We have the world's largest insight panels and our members actively participate in millions of surveys with advanced cross-reference & multi-faceted behavioral data points. The information we provide allows clients to understand behavioral trends, create immersive experiences, and be the best.

What You Will Be Doing

-Report to the Director of Platform Engineering, lead a growing team of high-performing engineers
-Help define and enforce DevOps standards, procedures, and guidelines to improve the overall development process
-Provide technical leadership and guidance to both your team members and your peers
-Cultivate a modern DevOps culture and mindset throughout your teams and establish performance metrics and processes to improve velocity and deliverability
-Deploy and support high-performance, highly-available infrastructure on AWS
-Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning
-Conduct periodic on-call duties
-Own the day-to-day health, uptime, monitoring, and reliability of our cloud infrastructure
-Work closely with engineering and project management to develop tools and solutions
-Identify tactical issues and react to emerging areas of concern
-Identify unnecessary complexity and remove it

What You Need for this Position

Must-Have Skills:
- 5+ years experience in an SRE/SysAdmin, DevOps, or equivalent role
- 3+ years of production AWS experience, including but not limited to EC2, RDS, ElastiCache, S3, Auto Scale, ELB
- 2+ years of experience in technical leadership role managing DevOps in Agile environments (Scrum)
- Capability to program in at least one language (other than Bash), ideally Python, PHP or Java
- Solid knowledge of the Linux architecture

Nice to Have Skills:
- Experience with container stacks and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, ECS, etc)
- Experience with Configuration Management tools such as Puppet, Chef, Salt, or Ansible
- Experience with Infrastructure as a Code framework such as Terraform
- Experience with Microservices
- Experience with application monitoring tools (DataDog, New Relic, SumoLogic, etc)
- Strong knowledge of core protocols and tech such as TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, load balancers, distributed file systems, key-value and relational databases
- Experience with CI/CD tools and production code deployments

What's In It for You

- Competitive Salary
- Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
- Flexible hours
- MacBook Pros
- Overall engaging and fun atmosphereSo, if you are a Lead DevOps Engineer, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

items.title: DevOps Engineer - Remote
items.content:
DevOps Engineer - Central London- £500-£600

I have partnered with a leading financial organisation who are looking for an Azure DevOps Engineer to help them on their Digital transformation. You will be largely responsible for building out their CI/CD pipelines using Team City and Octopus Deploy.

Alongside this the organisation currently have a small offering of Kubernetes however are looking to scale this. If you are looking to up-skill yourself within Kubernetes and haven't got Kubernetes working experience or are looking for more exposure, then this role will allow you to do this.

This fantastic opportunity is looking for a DevOps Engineer to come on ASAP.

YOU WILL HAVE:

- Azure
- Team City
- Octopus Deploy

If you would like to hear more about this opportunity, then don't delay, get in touch with me today!

items.content:
Titan School Solutions

Saas Devops Engineer

Titan School Solutions is an EdTech startup that is on the fast track for growth and changing the face of school nutrition. Our SaaS platform is recognized in the space for bringing state-of-the art efficiencies and real-time transparency into schools, all while remaining focused on the bigger outcome - helping K-12 students. Titan’s founders are school information technology veterans who have not only created a scalable and affordable solution but have also brought value into schools by delivering real results.   As we continue to sky rocket within this industry, we need a hands-on Sr. DevOps Engineer that can work collaboratively with our team in order to deploy and operate our highly impacted systems. We’re looking for someone who can overcome the challenges that come with a startup, do more with less, face a problem head on, automate and streamline our operations…and do it all while consistently resolving issues in our dev, test and production environments.  If you are a highly energetic self-starter with the ability to work independently in a remote environment, achieve results, focus on the details, and ultimately want to be part of transforming an institutional enterprise then…APPLY HERE!  WHERE YOU WILL BE IN ONE YEAR:  * TRANSFORM AN INDUSTRY! - You will be involved in an industry that is unlike any other. You will monitor high traffic volumes on a consistent basis and work in a fast-paced field that will expand your horizons and put you far above your peers. * MASTER OF GOOGLE CLOUD! - You will become a master in technology with a focus on Google Cloud by utilizing enterprise level capabilities of Google’s offerings.  * ACCELERATE YOUR CAREER!  - This is a transformational opportunity for someone who is looking to prove they can come into an organization on the ground level and fix its problems at the source. You will accelerate your career in half the time while having double the impact on our day to day operations.  WHAT YOU'LL DO TO GET THERE: * Work as part of a small technical team to build and manage a resilient and secure infrastructure for the various application platforms. * Collaborate with development team to not just maintain, but also build and improve the underlying systems to be highly available, scalable and highly performant. * Scale infrastructure to meet rapidly increasing demand and improve automated deployments, monitoring, management and incident response. * Monitor site database stability/performance and troubleshoot issues. * Collaborate with a team to create and execute load and performance tests. * Proactively meet standards for information security and compliance. * Have an attitude to always improve by constantly researching new technologies and services(example: SQL Server on Linux, .NET auto scaling on GCP, etc.) WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCEED: * Google Cloud Platform will be the main focus of preferred experience, if you have strong experience in AWS or Azure that will give you a great foundation to build upon. * Strong experience in Linux  and knowledge of automated builds and deployments such as TeamCity, Octopus Deploy, VSTS, etc. * Strong experience managing, monitoring, profiling and scaling Microsoft servers(SQL Server, Windows Server, IIS). * Strong knowledge and understanding of SaaS network architecture, security and troubleshooting techniques. * Experience creating and maintaining backup strategies as well as managing PCI compliant production environments. * Release automation, system administration, system configuration, and system debugging experience * Experience implementing and maintaining monitoring and alert systems. * Ability to operate in an agile, entrepreneurial start-up environment. YOUR TECH STACK(What you’ll be using): ASP.NET, WebAPI, MVC, Hangfire, C# Microsoft SQL Server 2016 Windows Server, IIS Web Server TeamCity, Octopus Deploy Cloud infrastructure: Google Cloud Platform SolarWinds Database Performance Analyzer Anturis server, network and web monitoring Bitbucket, Confluence, Jira Google Cloud Storage WHAT WE OFFER: At Titan School Solutions, we’re looking for bright, independent, self-motivated, and experienced people who have an entrepreneurial spirit and passion for technology. Our compensation packages consist of salary and a full suite of benefits to support our growing team. Titan offers all of the opportunity that comes with a startup but without the risk. It is backed by Cie, a startup accelerator, and Wavemaker Partners, a venture capital firm.  This position is available for remote employment in the United States and does require the team member to be on call. * Competitive salary: Based on experience and performance. * Health/Benefits: Medical, Dental, & Visual. 95% paid by employer! * Unlimited PTO: We believe in work/life balance to reward are rock stars for delivering great results.  * The Right Gear: All the bells and whistles you need to drive results. * 401k Matching: We offer a generous 401k plan and we match 100% up to 5%. * Ownership: You’ll be a crucial member of the initial build-out team, offering unlimited opportunity for growth and professional development.

items.content:
DevOps Engineer: Automate and scale infrastructure

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: Cybersecurity, SaaS
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: SecurityScorecard | New York, NY

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 4 hours
Office Location: New York, NY. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes

Technologies

amazon-web-services
ansible
devops
scripting
kubernetes

Job description

The Opportunity

SecurityScorecard is hiring an Ops Engineer to bridge the gap between our global development and operational teams who is motivated to help continue automating and scaling our infrastructure. The Ops Engineer will be responsible for setting up and managing the operation of project development and test environments as well as the software configuration management processes for the entire application development lifecycle. Your role would be to ensure the optimal availability, latency, scalability, and performance of our product platforms. You would also be responsible for automating production operations, promptly notifying backend engineers of platform issues, and checking long term quality metrics.

Our infrastructure is based on AWS with a mix of managed services like RDS, ElastiCache, and SQS, as well as hundreds of EC2 instances managed with Ansible and Terraform. We are actively using three AWS regions, and have equipment in several data centers across the world.

Responsibilities

  • Training, mentoring, and lending expertise to coworkers with regards to operational and security best practises. 
  • Reviewing and providing feedback on GitHub Pull Requests to team members AND development teams- a significant percentage of our Software Engineers have written Terraform.
  • Identifying opportunities for technical and process improvement and owning the implementation. 
  • Championing the concepts of immutable containers, Infrastructure as Code, stateless applications, and software observability throughout the organization.
  • Systems performance tuning with a focus on high availability and scalability.
  • Building tools to ease the usability and automation of processes
  • Keeping products up and operating at full capacity
  • Assisting with migration processes as well as backup and replication mechanisms
  • Working on a large-scale distributed environment where you were focused on scalability/reliability/performance
  • Ensuring proper monitoring / alerting are configured
  • Investigating incidents and performance lapses

Come help us with projects such as…

  • Extending our compute clusters to support low latency, on-demand job execution
  • Turning pets into cattle
  • Cross region replication of systems and corresponding data to support low latency access
  • Rolling out application performance monitoring to existing services, extending integrations where required
  • Migration from self hosted ELK to a SaaS stack
  • Continuous improvement of CI/CD processes making builds & deployments faster, safer, and more consistent
  • Extending a Global VPN WAN to a datacenter with IPSec+BGP

Requirements

  • 3+ years of DevOps and/or Operations experience
  • 1+ years of production environment experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • 1+ years using SQL databases (MySQL, Oracle, Postgres)
  • Scripting ability (Bash, Python, C++ a plus)
  • Strong Experience with CI/CD processes (Jenkins, Ansible) and automated configuration tools (Puppet/Chef/Ansible)
  • Experience with container orchestration (AWS ECS, Kubernetes, Marathon/Mesos)
  • Ability to work as part of a highly collaborative team
  • Understanding of monitoring tools like DataDog
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice to Have

  • You knew exactly what is meant by "Turning pets into cattle"
  • Experience working with Kubernetes on bare-metal and/or the AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service.
  • Experience with RabbitMQ, MongoDB, or Apache Kafka.
  • Experience with Presto or Apache Spark.
  • Familiarity with computation orchestration tools such as HTCondor, Apache Airflow, or Argo.
  • Understanding of network concepts- OSI layers, firewalls, DNS, split horizon DNS, VPN, routing, BGP, etc.
  • A deep understanding of AWS IAM, and how it interacts with S3 buckets.
  • Experience with SAFe.
  • Strong programming skills in 2+ languages.
Apply now

About SecurityScorecard

About SSC

At SecurityScorecard, we are revolutionizing the cyber security industry. Our platform has created a new category of enterprise software, which companies worldwide rely on to manage the cyber security posture of their vendors. We are on a mission to create a new language for companies and their partners to communicate, understand, and improve each other’s security posture.

Backed by Sequoia and Google Ventures, we are growing tremendously year over year. As we scale, so does our need for talent - if you are intellectually curious and excited by the idea of contributing to a high-growth startup, we’d love to talk to you.

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Health Benefits Starting Day One
  • 401k
  • Education Stipend
  • Learning and Development
  • Stocked Kitchen
  • Remote Work Options

items.content:
DevOps Engineer (m/f/d) // AIPARK

Company: AIPARK

Tags:
  • AWS
  • Kubernetes
  • Cloud technologies

    • AIPARK provides live parking maps for developers in mobility. Our AI-powered parking platform serves already more than one million monthly active drivers and processes traffic data from over eight million vehicles worldwide. Our customers include Automotive companies, Mobility service operators and Smart Cities. We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to bring our parking platform to the next level. You will be working with the latest technology as part of our experienced tech team.

    What you will do

    • Construction and maintenance of the productive environment in AWS
    • Take an active part in architectural decision and complex development tasks
    • Provide support in monitoring, backing up, reports, identification of issues and mitigation, and improving services
    • Configure CI/CD pipelines

    Your profile

    • Experience in processing data in a big scale and building up data pipelines
    • Knowledge of Cloud Technologies in particular AWS Clusters with Kubernetes and serverless technologies
    • A general addiction to DevOps
    • Profound knowledge of English and optionally German
    • Excellent verbal communication skills
    • Self-motivated attitude and attention to detail
    • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience that’s demonstrable (e.g. through open-source contributions etc.)

    What we offer

    • A team of motivated entrepreneurial colleagues from different nationalities
    • Steep learning curve in a fast-paced startup environment through challenging tasks,
    • an open minded and fun work environment
    • Possibility to quickly take over responsibility for own projects
    • Truly unique work environment in Berlin’s leading space for mobility companies, The Drivery
    • Flexible working hours
    • Home office option

    Interested?

    Send us an email to [email protected] with your CV and references as available attached. English and German applications are welcome. We will get back to you in no time!

    Note: This role can not be performed remotely, please apply only if you are in Berlin or are willing to move to Berlin. No recruiters, headhunters, outsourcers or agencies

    Apply for this position

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
AWS, Heroku, SALT, Ansible, Terraform, Postgres, Python, RUBY, Bash, RabbitMQ

If you are a DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer with experience, please read on!

We're located in sunny Southern California however we're looking for an experienced DevOps candidate to join our team - we allow 100% remote!! We're a technology/health company that is bridging the gap with user data to determine health behavior and needs. We received our Series C funding and we're ready to ramp up our team and product.

We offer great benefits including health, dental, and vision for your and your dependents; we also offer a relaxed and flexible work environment to accommodate any of the hiccups that life throws your way. Applications are reviewed and processed quickly - please apply today if you are interested.

**Application will be considered incomplete unless screening questions are answered; incomplete applications cannot be submitted for further review. Please answer all screening questions in detail in order to expedite the process.**

What You Will Be Doing

- Solving complex technical problems
- Working on product architecture and scalability of distributed systems
- Architect, develop & deploy the operation of our systems
- Ensure proper health and security of our systems & data
- Some on-call experience, distributed among the DevOps team
- Creating scalable pipelines for cost-effectiveness and security

What You Need for this Position

At Least 3 Years of experience and the following:

- Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or similar area of study
- Strong experience working in a Linux environment
- Previous experience in a DevOps culture
- Use of configuration management & automation tools (Chef, Puppet, Ansible)
- Working in the cloud (AWS is a big plus!)
- RDBMS experience (Postgres, MySQL)
- Messaging/queing systems (RabbitMQ, SQS, Kinesis)

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Team events
- Lunches
- 100% RemoteSo, if you are a DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer (100% Remote) with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

items.content:
Virtru | Senior DevOps/SRE | Team Lead DevOps/SRE | Security Engineer | FULL-TIME | Washington D.C. or REMOTE (US based) | https://www.virtru.com

Virtru offers a suite of products and backend APIs to enable data protection everywhere data is created or shared. We serve 5,000+ organizations with education, health care, government agencies, and finance being our biggest markets.

I'm a member of the SRE team, working closely with the security team. We're looking to grow both teams as we expand our infrastructure from two US regions into the EU and Asia-Pacific. We have strived to follow devops principles across the organization since day 1.

We are hiring for:

- DevOps Engineer, Team Lead - https://www.comeet.co/jobs/Virtru/64.00D/devops-engineer-tea...

- Senior DevOps Engineer: https://www.comeet.co/jobs/Virtru/64.00D/senior-devops-engin...

- Security Engineer: https://www.comeet.co/jobs/Virtru/64.00D/security-engineer/F...

Infrastructure stack: AWS w/ Terraform (EC2, S3, DynamoDB, SQS, KMS, etc), Docker on Ubuntu 16.04 baked with Ansible, Elasticsearch, Buildkite. Working towards orcestration with Kubernetes.Backend applications: Primarily NodeJS, some Go, Java, Python.

Medical, dental & vision, unlimited vacation, remote first culture (with a great office in downtown D.C)

E-mail me at emlynstokes@virtru.com with any questions and I'll send you a Virtru encrypted e-mail back.

items.content:
Senior System Engineer (Remote UTC 0 to UTC 3)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Web Design, Web Development, Web Hosting
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Amazee | Zürich, Switzerland

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Vienna +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Zürich, Switzerland. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

docker
kubernetes
hosting
open-source
openshift

Job description

PLEASE NOTE: This position requires that you work during standard office hours in Central Europe (UTC+0 to UTC+3)

Senior System Engineer

We are excited to introduce our latest job opening for amazee.io. We invite you to take a look at our website at amazee.io, read of the job description below, and to make contact with us if you find our offer exciting.

To apply, please upload a maximum one-page cover letter in PDF format. Your cover letter should showcase your communication style, introduce yourself, detail your relevant technical work experience, and highlighting anything you feel we should know before we make contact with you. Feel free to also upload a concise resume.

The company and the job

amazee.io provides a Drupal hosting Platform as a Service to clients worldwide. We excel in offering outstanding support and a local Docker-based development environment congruent to production servers, supporting production deployment to any server in any datacenter in the world.

Do you like to support and share knowledge with other engineers? Do you automate processes rather than doing the same thing three times? Do you believe in DevOps as a culture? Do you want to contribute to an open-source project on a daily basis? Then we may have the perfect job for you.

amazee.io is looking for a System Engineer to join our tech team. You will be essential in ensuring the happiness of our clients, the stability, and the growth of our high-performance hosting environment. We are a lean, open, international, and fully remote distributed team. 

Our hosting environment is based on Docker and Kubernetes/OpenShift, operates in multiple locations all over the world, is completely open source, and currently serves over 500 million hits per month. We are constantly updating and improving the platform and need bright minds who are interested in helping us scale to build the world's best and fastest Drupal hosting environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Client onboarding and training
  • Provide outstanding support to our clients via Slack and in E-Mail
  • Go the extra mile for our customers to provide trouble free deployments of their sites
  • Assist with ensuring the stability of our hosting environment
  • Specify, implement, document, and roll out features/updates
  • Support tech teams by being an advocate for and implementing DevOps Principles
  • Share the responsibility for frequent off hours “on call” duty

Requirements:

  • You prefer to work during standard office hours in Europe (UTC+0 to UTC+3)
  • 3 years+ of System-Engineer/System-Admin experience
  • Working knowledge of Linux, Nginx, Varnish, MariaDB/MySQL
  • Working knowledge of Drupal and PHP
  • Talking to clients and providing training to technical client personnel doesn’t scare you
  • Communicating effectively via cat gifs and emojis 
  • Experience with Docker
  • Basic knowledge of high availability and clustered servers
  • Basic knowledge of Mac OS X, Windows
  • You're able to self-organize, work independently, but also work as part of a globally distributed team
  • You are experienced with or are familiar with agile project methodologies and principles
  • Ability to analyze problems and keep calm and focused during outages
  • Very good at reading, writing, and communicating in English

Bonus points:

  • Experience with OpenShift and/or Kubernetes
  • Experience with AWS and/or Azure
  • Experience with server security and system hardening
  • Experience with Ansible, Node.js, or Golang
  • Experience with performance optimization and load testing
  • You like to share your knowledge by speaking at conferences and meetups

We offer:

  • Work in a very tight knit yet distributed team of creative professionals in a flat international organization
  • Opportunity to contribute daily to a open-source hosting environment that is the backbone to many international clients and organizations
  • Be part of a team that is driven by continuous improvement and does not shy away from change
  • Budget for tech equipment every two years - free choice of hardware to work with
  • Flexible working hours
  • Possibility to work remotely for 2 weeks per year from our Hubs in Zurich or Cape Town
  • Annual budget for education and conference attendance
  • An annual grant for health & wellness related things
  • 40-hour working week
  • 5 weeks of vacation plus 10 days annually for local holidays
  • Attendance to events and conferences

Work location:

Location is not that important, however a desire to work during business hours in the UTC+0 to UTC+3 timezone is critical.

If you are excited by the opportunity to join an international hosting company and think you might be a good fit, we would love to hear from you!

Application instructions

To apply, please upload a maximum one-page cover letter in PDF format. Your cover letter should introduce yourself, detail your relevant technical work experience, and highlighting anything you feel we should know before we make contact with you. Feel free to also upload a concise resume.

Apply now

About Amazee

amazee.io is an open source company that offers flexible, container-based hosting solutions made by developers for developers. Check out more about our company stack, mission, and company culture at http://amazee.io

Benefits

  • Bi-annual soft and hardware budget
  • Attend Conferences and Camps
  • Annual education budget
  • Annual fitness budget
  • After three years you get one month off to do something extreme
  • Young and international team
  • Possibility to work remotely
  • Possibility to work from other Amazee Hubs

items.content:
DevOps Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: Collaboration Tools, Cybersecurity
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Surevine | Bristol, UK

Remote details

Office Location: Bristol, UK. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

amazon-web-services
devops
linux
postgresql
mongodb

Job description

Do you love to learn and share with a team who can rely on you and your attention to detail? We want a team player; someone to help the team get things done in an environment that expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation. We are seeking a proactive DevOps Engineer to support a growing distributed team of exceptional software engineers. You will plan, deploy, maintain and secure critical business applications for Surevine as well as our software development projects, and our customers.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a small growing company and shape the way we work

Location: UK-wide remote base; with regular travel to Gloucestershire/Wiltshire

Start date: October 2019

Skills and experience

Essential

  • 5+ years within a software engineering environment, at least 2 of which as a DevOps Engineer
  • Strong background in Linux / Unix administration
  • Expertise in at least one of: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, MySQL or MariaDB
  • Experience with developing templates and playbooks for automation/configuration management e.g. Ansible or Amazon CloudFormation
  • Demonstratable experience in commodity cloud services such as AWS
  • Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an ‘Always-Up, Always-Available’ service
  • Understanding of virtualisation such as VMWare, VirtualBox, Xen and KVM
  • Detail-orientated with strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving aptitude
  • Familiar with development tools such as Jenkins, Atlassian Stack and Git
  • Ability to work supporting a number of different remote teams and projects

Highly desirable

  • AWS Foundation Certification or higher
  • Experience of managing and deploying containerised applications using Docker, LXC etc.
  • Experience of executing and interpreting automated security tests e.g. Burpsuite
  • Experience of implementing system monitoring using SNMP, Nagios, Check_MK etc.
  • Experience of supporting production applications based on one or more of the following: Jive, Alfresco, Rocketchat, Jitsi
  • Working understanding of code and script e.g. PHP, Python, Java and/or Ruby

Primary Responsibilities

  • Design and implement appropriate environments, often in AWS, for operational applications, and engineer suitable release management procedures and provide production support
  • Automate the provisioning of environments in AWS using technology that we adopt (Ansible / Docker) or bring in a new approach
  • Design and develop automation workflows, perform unit tests and conduct reviews to make sure your work is rigorously designed, elegantly coded, and effectively tuned for platform performance, and assess the overall quality of delivered components
  • Influence our software development teams to adopt DevOps best practices
  • Troubleshoot problems; involving the appropriate people from within Surevine and our support partners to drive resolution of issues, with a focus on minimising impact to our customers
  • Participate in the Agile DevOps design, development, testing and release of new capabilities and features, with a focus on release and post-production support
  • Be part of our Care (support) team, working to SLAs and sharing responsibility for providing extended hours support for a number of our operational products

Secondary Responsibilities

  • Act as a Service Lead for one of our support projects, taking responsibility for driving continuous improvement to both the production environment and supporting processes
  • Support development of corporate Security Policy, ISO27001 compliance and change management, situation / disaster analysis
  • Security engineering infrastructure development e.g. hardening security environment
Apply now

About Surevine

Surevine builds secure, scalable collaboration solutions for the most security conscious organisations; joining people up and enabling collaboration on their most sensitive information. Our systems are accredited to handle the most sensitive information, whilst still delivering an intuitive and engaging user experience which actively promotes participation; building smart, secure networks of connected people. Our own smart research and development and customer sponsored R&D into collaboration technology delivers constant innovation, building products born out of genuine user needs.

Reasons to join

  • Opportunity to work amongst a team of exceptional developers working on and with the latest technologies
  • Be part of an agile, delivery-focussed team with daily stand-ups, fortnightly sprints, and retrospectives
  • Our belief in self-managed teams and reliance on self-motivated people
  • Our Director’s aren’t hidden away. They are accessible and involved. They are our co-workers
  • Chance to work in an fast-moving innovative environment with some tough problems for you to help us solve
  • Everyone is provided with a budget to kit out their workspace and make it cooler and more productive than they would ever get in a corporate cube
  • We don’t wear suits (often)

Benefits

  • Flexible working hours
  • Exceptional developers working on and with the latest technologies
  • Hubs for co-working
  • Generous budget to kit out your workspace (beats a corporate cube)
  • We don't wear suits
  • Agile, delivery-focussed team with daily stand-ups, sprints and retros
  • Beers on the Directors (if The Smiths are playing)
  • 23+ days holiday
  • Shiny kit

items.content:
Bring your technical expertise to our industry-leading and technology-focused client. Eliassen Group is searching for an experienced Senior DevOps Engineer to automate innovative web applications by embracing new groundbreaking technologies. To be successful in this role, you will need to be skilled in Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Ansible, GoLang, Ruby, Python, Postgres / SQL, and AWS cloud services.

As the Senior DevOps Engineer, you will join an industry leading team leveraging Agile that is creating quality code from scratch, utilizing lean techniques such as continuous integration and deployment, and story based iterative development. The Senior DevOps Engineer will work on a team, automating state of the art applications, building a solid RDBMA persistence platform inside Kubernetes, and be involved providing leadership on complex projects.

Duration: 12+ month contract (Can be 100% remote)

Rate: $70.00/hour W2 - $80.00/hour W2 + Health, Dental, Vision, 401k Benefits

The Senior DevOps Engineer will possess the following skills:
  • 5+ years- experience in containerization tools like Kubernetes and Docker
  • 5+ years- experience Scripting knowledge (GoLang, Ruby, Python, etc.)
  • 5+ years- experience with Ansible, Terraform, Jenkins, Chef, Puppet, etc.
  • Strong expertise in AWS
  • Experience with Git, MS Build highly preferred
  • Experience in TDD, ATDD would be a plus
  • Lead, motivate, and engage team members to cultivate a culture of excellence


For immediate consideration, please send your MS Word resume to

Keywords: DevOps Engineer, DevOps, GoLang, Ruby, Python, Ansible, Terrafrom, Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, Postgres, SQL, APIs, JavaScript, Angular, React, backbone.js, knockout.js, VSTS, MS Build, TDD, ATDD, BDD, pair programming, Agile, Scrum, Lean

Job ID: 328793

About Eliassen Group:

Eliassen Group provides strategic talent solutions to drive our clients- innovation and business results. Leveraging over 30 years of success, our expertise in IT staffing, Agile consulting, creative services, managed services, and life sciences enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence, deep networks, as well as national reach. For more information, visit .

Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Don-t miss out on our referral program! If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a $1,000 referral check !
- provided by Dice

items.title: Senior Technology Leadership Professional Automation Anywhere (remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

The Senior Technology Leadership Professional for Automation Anywhere is responsible for all aspects of software or hardware product delivery and performance. The Senior Technology Leadership Professional work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.


Responsibilities



The Senior Technology Leadership Professional oversees the technical implementation of the Automation Anywhere (AA) platform at Humana. He or she installs, upgrades, and maintains AA infrastructure, including Control Room, Bot Insights, and IQ Bot on a cloud platform and oversees the certification and deployment of AA client versions. The AA architect works closely with the corporate identity and access management team to implement security processes and protocols for AA. She or he provides top-level support for AA technical problems encountered by all stakeholders. The AA architect works closely with the AA vendor to identify and maintain a list of desired AA enhancements and drive implementation of those enhancements. The AA architect defines processes and procedures for AA development, both for citizen developer (business) teams and IT teams, and creates documentation. He or she integrates AA with other RPA and cognitive tools and other IT resources.

Responsibilities:

  • Infrastructure
    • Install, upgrade, and maintain Automation Anywhere infrastructure on Amazon Web Services.
    • Coordinate certification and deployment of the AA client.
    • Draft AA hardware plans and budgets.
    • Collaborate with other IT teams to obtain cloud resources, server backups, DNS entries, certificates, disaster recovery, etc.
    • Oversee implementation of Automation Anywhere on Citrix XenApp.
    • Develop AA integrations with corporate DevOps tools including code scanning and test automation tools.
    • Perform change management and provide system notifications for infrastructure changes.
  • Security
    • Work with the corporate identity and access management (IAM) team to develop processes and procedures for Automation Anywhere security provisioning.
    • Develop integrations with corporate IAM tools.
    • Provision and manage system accounts, groups, shared mailboxes, and distribution lists needed for AA operations.
  • Support
    • Provide third-level support for Automation Anywhere problems and issues.
    • Liaise support tickets with Automation Anywhere support.
    • Serve as a top-level resource for other RPA application architects, AA trainers, AA security team, AA IT developers, AA citizen developers, AA code reviewers, AA production systems management team, and other stakeholders.
    • Implement AA monitoring tools.
  • Vendor Relations
    • Maintain desired Automation Anywhere enhancements list and drive enhancements with the vendor.
    • Liaise with firms providing Automation Anywhere consultation to Humana.
    • Support business process outsourcing organizations who use the internal AA platform.
  • Process and Procedure
    • Define procedures for bot, credential, locker, role, user, and license administration.
    • Define the activities, artifacts, and approvals needed for the AA software development lifecycle (SDLC) for both citizen developer (CD) teams and the IT RPA team.
    • Define AA development standards.
    • Write documentation for CD teams and IT RPA team.
  • IT Integration
    • Integrate AA with other RPA and cognitive tools.
    • Integrate AA with other IT resources through database queries, ETL jobs, service calls, and other integration tools.



Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 5+ years of technical experience
  • Experience with the technologies in use in the application(s) or infrastructure
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate and communicate effectively across varying levels of personnel
  • Experience with unit testing and mocking
  • Strong proficiency in verbal and written communication.
  • Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Conceptual understanding of UI-interaction technologies such as WinAPI, MSAA, Java Access Bridge, DOM, EHLLAPI, etc.
  • Proven results in working with vendors to enhance commercial applications.
  • MBA or other Advanced Degree
  • Demonstrated ability running large scale projects
  • Experience with technology solutions assessments and/or strategy planning oversight
  • AA platform-level certification such as -Control Room Administrator- or -IT Infra Administrator.-
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
  • Experience with Puppet.
  • Experience with DynaTrace OneAgent.
  • Experience with Active Directory.
  • Experience with version control tools - Git, SVN
  • Experience with both relational and NoSQL databases including data modelling, data description language (DDL), and stored procedure development.
  • Experience with developing APIs and service calls, using both SOAP and REST.
  • Understanding of iterative development methodologies and terminology such as DevOps, Squads, and Agile.


Additional Information


Scheduled Weekly Hours

40
- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=43, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Site Reliability Engineer - 100% Remote

***Candidates must be US Citizens or Permanent Residents. Our client cannot transfer/sponsor for any type of visa at this time and you must join them full-time.***

This position will report to our Director of Technical Operations. Although it will require you to participate in an on-call rotation on nights and weekends, work/life balance is important to us and we empower our employees to identify and resolve issues before they lead to incidents and alerts. We are looking for candidates who are skilled in both managing their everyday tasks and improving their environment.

As a Site Reliability Engineer, a typical day may include the following:

  • Monitoring and maintaining the Development, Testing/QA, Staging and Production environments
  • Mitigating production performance issues effectively by taking responsibility for seeing those performance issues through resolution with the goal of automating to prevent problem recurrence
  • Scheduling, testing and maintaining application deployments and pipelines
  • Working with engineering to perform capacity planning, analysis, implementation and testing of the platform
  • Working closely with team members and development to improve existing systems
  • Assisting and working with the DBA to increase reliability and automation
  • Participating in on-call/on-demand network, server and database support

This job may be right for you if you have:

  • 5+ years of experience administering a consumer-facing Microsoft Web Platform (IIS, ASP.NET/.NET Core, MSSQL)
  • 3+ years of experience setting up and administering high availability solutions in Windows Servers
  • 5+ years of experience administering and maintaining MSSQL and Active Directory
  • Demonstrable knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, web application security and distributed applications
  • Experience, skills and knowledge of MSSQL environments
  • Experience with mixed Infrastructure, Virtual and Cloud-based server environments
  • Experience with load balancing and multi-layer application stacks
  • Demonstrable expertise around specifying, designing and/or implementing system health, performance monitoring tools and software management tools for 24x7 environments
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills required to work in our culture-driven team environment

You re extra awesome if you have:

  • Interest and experience within the hobby gaming industry
  • Knowledge of agile development methodologies
  • Familiarity with IaaS and PaaS solutions (i.e. Azure, AWS)
  • Familiarity with Elasticsearch
  • Familiarity with Linux
  • Demonstrated proficiency in writing build scripts to automate tasks that can be automated
  • Knowledge of common systems/development tools
  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet or Ansible
  • Computer Science fundamentals in data structures, algorithm design and problem solving
- provided by Dice
